intro: Hieracium subcaulescens, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium subcaulescens is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
